answers.answer: Glad to hear you don't have to have a c section!! I'm sure your lil one will be healthy and a strong fighter!!
Thank you :) I'm stuck in here for another week seen 4women go to the labour ward...one being me....but I've been sent back Haha boo :( what are the chances he'll be okay if born at 36-37week x
That's great news!! Wish you and your bundle of joy much happiness :) and a safe and quick recovery
He will.be fine, considered full term.at 37 weeks anyway. Good luck x
Thank you :) can't help having that horrible feeling at the back of my head that something is going to be wrong :(

Don't think that love think positive thoughts many women have their children early due to medical reasons and its better he come out than try to fight inside...I'm glad you don't have to have a c-section though...good luck and can't wait to hear and see pic of when he arrives :))

My god daughter was born at 36 weeks and was perfect. Needed a few days in hospital but is fully grow and nearly a year. I'm so glad you get to meet your son soon. Congratulations and I hope your delivery is safe :-) x
I had Preeclampsia and my water broke at 36 Weeks, my son was perfectly healthy. Just a little jaundice which is common in early babies.
Thanks guys :) eased my mind a lot just can't wait to meet the little dude ! X

question: So I'm glad I don't have to have c section anymore due to high blood pressure. Its still high and the doctor's are inducing me in the next couple of days :) I'm only 36+1 and I've had the steroid shots...weird to know that before the week is over I'm going to have my son :D woo ! Just wish he could have stayed in there longer ... x
title: Update on Pre-eclampsia
